questiontext.text:
Consider a simply supported beam as shown above with length L.

There are two supports at either end of the beam,which generate reaction forces R1 and R2, at positions x=0 and x=L respectively.

There are two Uniformly Distributed Loads (UDLs) acting on the beam as shown in the diagram.

Below is the equivalent Free Body Diagram using only Point Loads.

Using the convention that upward forces and anti-clockwise moments are positive, and the information given:

a) Calculate the reaction forces R1 and R2 to the nearest whole number.

R1 = {1:NUMERICAL:=134:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

R2 = {1:NUMERICAL:=127:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

b) Calculate and draw the Shear Force Diagram (SFD) on paper and identify the following values:

Shear Force just to the right of A i.e (x=0).

{1:NUMERICAL:=134:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of B i.e. (x=30).

{1:NUMERICAL:=134:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of C i.e. (x=80).

{1:NUMERICAL:= -7:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of D i.e. (x=180).

{1:NUMERICAL:=-127:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

Shear Force just to the right of F i.e. (x=200).

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the SFD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~=A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:=A vertical line and a slope.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

4) D and F {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~=A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~A curve}

c) Calculate and draw the Bending Moment Diagram (BMD) on paper and identify the following values:

Bending moment at A.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at B.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 40:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at C.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 92:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at D.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 25:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

Bending Moment at F.

{1:NUMERICAL:= 0:1#Good job!~*#Sorry. Try again.} N.m

From the drop down menus below indicate how the indicated points are connected in the BMD

1) A and B {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

2) B and C {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

3) C and D {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~A combination of a slope and a curve.~A line with a slope.~=A curve}

4) D and F {1:MULTICHOICE:Either a horizontal or vertical line.~A combination of horizontal and vertical lines.~=A line with a slope.~A curve}

d) Where does the maximum bending moment occur?

{1:NUMERICAL:= 80:1#Good job!The BMD is a maximum at the x intercept of the SFD.~*#Sorry. Try again.The BMD is a maximum at the x intercept of the SFD.} cm

d) What is the maximum bending moment?

{1:NUMERICAL:= 92:1#Good job!The maximum bending moment is found by taking moments about the position where the SFD goes to 0.~*#Sorry. Try again.The maximum bending moment is found by taking moments about the position where the SFD goes to 0.} N.m
